document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the new wandering spider genus Ohvida and taxonomic remarks on Celaetycheus Simon, 1897 (Araneae: Ctenidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the new wandering spider genus Ohvida and taxonomic remarks on Celaetycheus Simon, 1897 (Araneae: Ctenidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ctenus brevitarsus
Bryant 1940
: 379
, figs 159, 164 (male holotype from Guantánamo, Cuba ,
10 .III. 1913
, Ramsden, deposited in
MCZ 20587
; a female allotype and a male paratype with the same data as holotype ; a male paratype from Guantánamo, Cuba ,
12 .IV. 1913
, Ramsden; a female paratype from Soledad, Granma, Cuba ,
II. 1925
, Salt; a male paratype and a female paratype from Soledad, Granma, Cuba ,
12 .VIII. 1931
, Worley; a male paratype from Mina Carlota, Trinidad , Sancti Spiritus, Cuba ,
19–25 .III. 1925
, Salt & Myers; a female paratype from Mina Carlota, Trinidad , Sancti Spiritus, Cuba ,
8–14 .V. 1936
, P. Darlington; a male paratype from Pico Turquino , Santiago de Cuba , Cuba ,
VI. 1936
, P. Darlington, all deposited in MCZ , examined).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Males of
Ohvida brevitarsus
resemble those of
O. vernalis
by the shape of RTA and median apophysis, but can be distinguished by the elongated retrodorsal projection on cymbium and by the laminar projection in the embolus (
Figs 3
A–B). Females of
Ohvida brevitarsus
resemble those of
O. vernalis
by the shape of the median plate and the round head of the spermathecae, but can be distinguished by the comparatively large size of the epigyne and internally by the large posterior area of the copulatory ducts (
Figs 3
C–D).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Ohvida brevitarsus (Bryant)
comb. nov.
A–B, male, left palp (MCZ 20587): A, ventral view; B, retrolateral view; C–D, epigyne (MCZ 34472): C, ventral view; D, dorsal view. Scale bars: 1.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description . Male ( holotype ). Total length 8.60 . Carapace 5.10 long, 3.80 wide. Clypeus 0.22 high. Eye diameter: AME 0.22 , ALE 0.20 , PME 0.28 , PLE 0.28 . Leg measurements: I: femur 5.70 / patella 2.60 / tibia 6.00/ metatarsus 4.90 / tarsus 2.10 / total 21.30 ; II: 5.35 / 2.50 / 4.90 / 4.50 / 1.70 / 18.95 ; III: 4.70 / 2.00/ 4.20 / 4.50 / 1.60 / 17.00; IV: 6.10 / 2.50 / 5.50 / 7.30 / 2.10 / 23.50 . Leg spination: tibia I and II
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 - 2 , r 1 - 1 -0, p 1 - 1 - 0, III and IV
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 ; metatarsus I, II
v 2 - 2
- 2 , p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; III
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r 1 - 1 - 1 , p- 1 - 1 - 1 , IV
v 1 - 1
- 1 - 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 . Palp: acute RTA; cymbium with an elongated and rounded retrodorsal apophysis; rounded median apophysis (
Figs 3
A–B).

Female (
MCZ 34472
). Total length 18.80 . Carapace 6.50 long, 4.80 wide. Clypeus 0.30 high. Eye diameter: AME 0.27 , ALE 0.22 , PME 0.40 , PLE 0.35 . Leg measurements: I: femur 4.80 / patella 2.50 / tibia 4.10 / metatarsus 3.40 / tarsus 1.50 / total 16.30 ; II: 4.50 / 2.50 / 3.70 / 3.10 / 1.30 / 15.10 ; III: 4.10 / 2.00/ 3.10 / 3.20 / 1.30 / 13.70 ; IV: 5.40 / 2.40 / 4.60 / 5.40 / 1.60 / 19.40 . Leg spination: tibia I and II
v 2 - 2
- 2 - 2 - 2 , r0, p0, III and IV
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 ; metatarsus I, II
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r0, p0; III
v 2 - 2
- 2 , r 1 - 1 - 1 , p- 1 - 1 - 1 , IV
v 1 - 1
- 1 - 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 . Epigyne: short lateral spurs and internally with rounded head of spermathecae (
Figs 3
C–D).

Variation .
2 males
: total 8.60–11.50 , carapace 5.10–6.80 , femur I 5.70–6.10 ;
2 females
: total 11.70–18.80 , carapace 6.30–6.50 , femur I 4.80 –5.00.
